intro: Eschscholzia vaccarum, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its bright orange or red petals and its distinctive, slender stem. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often found in open fields and along roadsides. Eschscholzia vaccarum is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species.
